results.title: Noah's Ark (K)
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions and Bill Justice
results.brief_description: An updated version of the story of Noah’s Ark, which will trigger children’s interest in biblical stories and initiate classroom discussion. The film is inventive in its use of three-dimensional animation techniques that would be of special interest to film study classes.

results.title: Noah's ark
results.creator_credit: Babelsberg International Film Produktion, Stephen Jones and John irvin
results.brief_description: Australia provides the backdrop for this loose retelling of the eternal story of biblical hero Noah (Jon Voight), the great flood that destroyed the world, and the ark that was built by Noah and his family and housed two of every animal species. This made for television movie was not well received by critics, despite its international cast of Jon Voight, Mary Steenburgen and F. Murray Abraham.

results.title: No.1 = Number one
results.brief_description: Presented as a visual essay, without commentary, this film concentrates on the physical movements of a top German soccer goal-keeper in a straight time series from an actual game, through training to the big match.

results.title: No worries
results.creator_credit: Palm Beach Pictures, Initial (GB), Southern Star Entertainment, David Elfick and Eric Fellner
results.brief_description: The courage of Ben and Ellen Beel and their 11-year-old daughter, Matilda, has seen them through countless misfortunes in a country plagued by the harsh elements. Drought is again parching the Australian outback with devastating consequences, and having barely survived the recession of the early 1990’s, the Bells now face an ever tumbling wool price dwindling their profits and their sheep dying of starvation. When all seems lost and they must leave their beloved home to move to the city, the never-say-die Aussie spirit triumphs - no worries!

results.title: No way they want to slow down
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Desmond Dew, Tom Daly and Giles Walker
results.brief_description: This documentary takes an informal look at how the best skiers work and live. The Canadian Ski Team is on a tight schedule down in Chile and Argentina. Two and a half tons of equipment, speeds of up to 140 km/h, gruelling work-outs, and a dramatic theft are all par for the course. And what a course. Downhill racing is definitely not for the timid. Commentary by John Lang.

results.title: No turning back (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Depicts the process of training guide dogs for the blind by following the training of Michael Waldock and his dog. In 1984 Michael was awarded the Young Australian of the Year Award for his maning of the emergency coast guard on CB radio.

results.title: No toothache for Eskimos
results.brief_description: A 5-minute version of “Let’s keep our teeth” suitable for young children (8-11 years of age) which shows the tough primitive diet of the Eskimos. Children are attracted by the food sequences which, linked with points about the reasons for tooth decay, make a quick transition from amusement to instruction. Vividly portrays life in the Arctic.

results.title: No time to spare
results.brief_description: Gives a detailed demonstration of the Holger-Nielsen method of applying artificial respiration. Shows the technique applied to an adult and a child, pointing out the operator’s position, placement of hands, action and timing.

results.title: No tears for Rachel
results.brief_description: All females, of whatever age, are potential rape victims. Rachel, a young American woman in her twenties, is a rape victim. Rachel tells of her experience, the reaction of her friends to the rape, and her current attitude to the crime. Psychiatrists, lawyers and policemen also discuss the crime of rape and the stigma associated with being raped.
